cheek.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the soft round part of your face below each of your eyes
cheek.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Lucy stretched up to kiss his cheek.
Billy had rosy cheeks and blue eyes.
Julie’s cheeks flushed with pleasure at the compliment.
cheek.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: disrespectful or rude behaviour, especially towards someone in a position of authority
cheek.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I’ve had enough of your cheek.
She’s got a cheek; she just goes on till she gets what she wants.
It’s a bit of a cheek, asking me for money.
What a cheek! Of course I read the instructions!
He had the cheek to make personal remarks and expect no reaction.
have the cheek to do something
cheek.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: one of the two soft fleshy parts of your bottom
cheek.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to speak rudely or with disrespect to someone, especially to someone older such as your teacher or parents
cheek.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: You can cheek some teachers and they just don’t do anything.
